questions.question: Worker A finishes a job in 6 hours. Worker B finishes it in 3 hours. Working together, how long?
questions.hint: Add their rates: $\frac{1}{6} + \frac{1}{3} = ?$ Then find the time from combined rate.

questions.question: Two cars 300 km apart drive toward each other. Car A at 70 km/h, Car B at 80 km/h. How far from A's start do they meet?
questions.hint: Time to meet = $300 \div 150 = 2$ hours. A travels $70 \times 2$.

questions.question: A tank has inlet A (fills in 4h), inlet B (fills in 6h), and drain C (empties in 8h). All open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{8}$. Find common denominator.

questions.question: 6 workers finish in 8 hours. After 2 hours, 2 workers leave. How much longer to finish?
questions.hint: Calculate work done in 2 hours, then remaining work with 4 workers.

questions.question: A boat travels 20 km upstream in 5 hours and 20 km downstream in 2 hours. What's the current speed?
questions.hint: Upstream speed = 4 km/h, downstream = 10 km/h. Current = $(10-4) \div 2$.

questions.question: A and B together take 12 hours. A alone takes 20 hours. How long for B alone?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{12} = \frac{1}{20} + \frac{1}{B}$. Solve for B.

questions.question: A train 150 m long overtakes a man walking at 6 km/h in 15 seconds. What's the train's speed?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 150m ÷ 15s = 10 m/s = 36 km/h. Train = $36 + 6$.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 4 hours, Pipe B in 12 hours. A runs for 2 hours, then B joins. Total time?
questions.hint: A does $\frac{1}{2}$ in 2 hours. Remaining $\frac{1}{2}$ by both together takes...

questions.question: A car goes 120 km at 40 km/h, then 120 km at 60 km/h. What's the average speed?
questions.hint: Total distance = 240 km. Total time = $3 + 2 = 5$ hours. Average = $240 \div 5$.

questions.question: Worker A is twice as fast as B. Together they finish in 4 hours. How long for A alone?
questions.hint: If A's rate is $2x$, B's rate is $x$. Together: $3x$. Set up the equation.

questions.question: Two trains 200 km apart travel toward each other. One at 60 km/h leaves 30 min before the other at 80 km/h. When do they meet?
questions.hint: After 30 min, gap = 170 km. Combined speed = 140 km/h. Time = $170 \div 140$.

questions.question: A cistern fills in 9 hours. A leak empties it in 18 hours. How long to fill with leak?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{9} - \frac{1}{18}$. Find common denominator.

questions.question: 10 men finish work in 18 days. After 6 days, 5 men leave. How many more days?
questions.hint: Work done in 6 days by 10 men. Remaining work done by 5 men.

questions.question: A plane flies 600 km with wind in 2 hours. Against same wind, it takes 3 hours. What's the plane's speed in still air?
questions.hint: With wind: 300 km/h. Against: 200 km/h. Plane = $(300 + 200) \div 2$.

questions.question: 8 workers finish $\frac{3}{4}$ of a job in 6 hours. How many workers to finish the rest in 2 hours?
questions.hint: Find rate from first part, then calculate workers for remaining $\frac{1}{4}$.

questions.question: Two pipes together fill in 6 hours. One pipe alone takes 5 hours more than the other. Find the faster pipe's time.
questions.hint: Let faster = $x$ hours. Slower = $x+5$. Set up: $\frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{x+5} = \frac{1}{6}$.

questions.question: A train 300 m long passes a bridge 200 m long in 25 seconds. What's the train's speed in km/h?
questions.hint: Total distance = 500 m. Speed = $500 \div 25 = 20$ m/s = 72 km/h.

questions.question: A can do $\frac{1}{3}$ of work in 5 days. B joins and they finish the rest in 3 days. B alone would take?
questions.hint: A's rate = $\frac{1}{15}$ per day. Together they do $\frac{2}{3}$ in 3 days. Find B's rate.

questions.question: Car A at 60 km/h leaves at 8 AM. Car B at 80 km/h leaves at 9 AM same direction. When does B catch A?
questions.hint: A's head start = 60 km. B gains 20 km/h. Catch-up time = 3 hours after 9 AM.

questions.question: A pool has two inlets (fill in 3h and 4h) and one outlet (empty in 6h). Starting empty, all open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} - \frac{1}{6}$. Find common denominator.

questions.question: A's efficiency is 150% of B's. B's efficiency is 80% of C's. If C takes 30 hours alone, how long for all 3?
questions.hint: Express A and B rates in terms of C's rate. Then add all three.

questions.question: A man rows 15 km upstream in 3 hours and 15 km downstream in 1.5 hours. His speed in still water?
questions.hint: Upstream = 5 km/h, downstream = 10 km/h. Man's speed = $(5 + 10) \div 2$.

questions.question: 12 workers working 6 hours/day finish in 10 days. How many days for 15 workers at 8 hours/day?
questions.hint: Total work = $12 \times 6 \times 10 = 720$ worker-hours. Divide by $(15 \times 8)$.

questions.question: A, B, C together take 4 hours. A alone takes 12 hours, B alone 8 hours. C alone?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{4} = \frac{1}{12} + \frac{1}{8} + \frac{1}{C}$. Solve for C.

questions.question: A train passes a pole in 10 seconds and a 150 m platform in 25 seconds. Find the train's length.
questions.hint: Speed = length ÷ 10. Also speed = (length + 150) ÷ 25. Solve.

questions.question: Tap A fills in 20 hours. Tap B fills in 30 hours. Both run for 4 hours, then only B runs. Total time?
questions.hint: In 4 hours: $\frac{4}{20} + \frac{4}{30} = \frac{1}{3}$. B fills remaining $\frac{2}{3}$ at $\frac{1}{30}$ per hour.

questions.question: Two cars start from same point at same time. One north at 40 km/h, one east at 30 km/h. When are they 100 km apart?
A types at 60 words/min, B at 40 words/min. They type 5000 words. A leaves after 30 min. Total time?
questions.hint: In 30 min, both type 3000 words. B types remaining 2000 alone.

questions.question: A tank has capacity 1000 liters. Inlet at 50 L/min, outlet at 30 L/min. Starting with 200 L, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = 20 L/min. Need 800 L more. Time = $800 \div 20$.

questions.question: 5 men and 3 women finish in 4 days. 3 men and 5 women finish in 5 days. How long for 2 men and 2 women?
questions.hint: Set up two equations with man-days and woman-days. Solve the system.

questions.question: A train 100 m long traveling at 60 km/h passes another train 150 m long going same direction at 40 km/h. Time to pass?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 20 km/h = $\frac{50}{9}$ m/s. Distance = 250 m. Time = $250 \div \frac{50}{9}$.

questions.question: A completes $\frac{3}{5}$ of work, B completes $\frac{1}{4}$, C does the rest. If C takes 3 hours for his part, how long for all 3 together?
questions.hint: C does $\frac{3}{20}$ of work in 3 hours. Find all rates and combine.

questions.question: A motorcyclist travels 120 km. First half at 40 km/h, second half at 60 km/h. Average speed?
Pipe A fills in 12 hours. After half filled, pipe B (fills in 18 hours) joins. How much longer?
questions.hint: A takes 6 hours for half. Both together fill remaining half.

questions.question: A and B complete $\frac{3}{5}$ of work in 6 days. B finishes the rest in 8 days. A alone would take?
questions.hint: From B's solo work, find B's rate. Then find A's rate from combined work.

questions.question: Two trains 500 km apart travel toward each other. One leaves 1 hour earlier at 50 km/h, other at 75 km/h. Distance from slower's start when they meet?
questions.hint: After 1 hour, gap = 450 km. Meeting time from second train's start = $450 \div 125$.

questions.question: A machine breaks down $\frac{1}{4}$ of the time. With B (no breakdowns), a job takes 8 hours. A alone takes 18 hours effective. B alone?
questions.hint: A's effective rate is $\frac{3}{4} \times \frac{1}{18}$. Set up equation with combined rate = $\frac{1}{8}$.

questions.question: Inlet A fills in 10 hours, B in 15 hours, outlet C empties in 6 hours. All open, what happens?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{10} + \frac{1}{15} - \frac{1}{6} = \frac{3}{30} + \frac{2}{30} - \frac{5}{30}$. Check again...

questions.question: 7 boys and 5 girls finish in 4 hours. 3 boys and 7 girls finish in 6 hours. How long for 1 boy and 1 girl?
questions.hint: Set up two equations. Solve for boy-rate and girl-rate.

questions.question: A boat's speed in still water is 12 km/h. It takes same time to go 16 km upstream as 24 km downstream. Current speed?
questions.hint: $\frac{16}{12-c} = \frac{24}{12+c}$. Cross multiply and solve for $c$.

questions.question: Three workers A, B, C can complete a job in 10, 12, and 15 hours respectively. They start together but A leaves after 2 hours. How long total?
questions.hint: Calculate work done in first 2 hours by all three. Then B and C finish the rest.

questions.question: A cyclist covers 40 km at 20 km/h and returns at 10 km/h. What is the average speed for the round trip?
questions.hint: Total distance = 80 km. Total time = 2 + 4 = 6 hours. Average speed?

questions.question: Two pipes fill a tank in 15 and 20 hours. A drain empties it in 10 hours. If all three are open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{15} + \frac{1}{20} - \frac{1}{10}$. Find common denominator 60.

questions.question: Worker A is 25% more efficient than B. If B takes 20 hours, how long for both together?
questions.hint: A takes $\frac{20}{1.25} = 16$ hours. Combined rate = $\frac{1}{16} + \frac{1}{20}$.

questions.question: A train 200 m long crosses a man running at 10 km/h in the same direction in 24 seconds. Train's speed?
questions.hint: Relative speed = $\frac{200}{24}$ m/s. Convert and add man's speed.

questions.question: 8 men can do a piece of work in 12 days. 4 women can do it in 48 days. How long for 6 men and 3 women?
questions.hint: Find rate per man and per woman. Combine 6 men and 3 women rates.

questions.question: A boat goes 24 km downstream in 2 hours and returns in 4 hours. Speed of current?
questions.hint: Downstream = 12 km/h, upstream = 6 km/h. Current = $(12 - 6) \div 2$.

questions.question: A does half the work in 8 days. Then B joins and they finish in 3 more days. B alone would take?
questions.hint: A's rate = $\frac{1}{16}$ per day. In 3 days together they do $\frac{1}{2}$. Find B's rate.

questions.question: Two taps fill a tank in 10 and 15 hours. Tap A runs for 3 hours, then both run. When is tank full?
questions.hint: A does $\frac{3}{10}$ alone. Remaining $\frac{7}{10}$ by both at rate $\frac{1}{6}$ per hour.

questions.question: A train takes 20 seconds to pass a 200 m platform and 10 seconds to pass a pole. What is the train's length?
questions.hint: Speed = length ÷ 10. Also (length + 200) ÷ 20 = same speed. Solve.

questions.question: 15 workers complete $\frac{2}{3}$ of a project in 8 days. How many more workers needed to finish the rest in 2 days?
questions.hint: Find work rate from first part. Calculate workers needed for remaining $\frac{1}{3}$ in 2 days.

questions.question: Car A travels at 50 km/h and Car B at 70 km/h. B starts 2 hours after A. How far from start when B catches A?
questions.hint: A's head start = 100 km. B gains 20 km/h. Time for B to catch = 5 hours.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 8 hours, B fills in 12 hours. Both open for 3 hours, then A closed. How much longer for B?
questions.hint: In 3 hours: $\frac{3}{8} + \frac{3}{12} = \frac{5}{8}$. B fills remaining $\frac{3}{8}$ alone.

questions.question: A's work rate is 3 times B's rate. Together they finish in 6 hours. How long for B alone?
questions.hint: If B's rate = x, then A's = 3x. Together 4x = $\frac{1}{6}$ per hour.

questions.question: A plane flies 1200 km with tailwind in 2 hours, and same distance with headwind in 3 hours. Wind speed?
questions.hint: With wind: 600 km/h. Against: 400 km/h. Wind = $(600 - 400) \div 2$.

questions.question: 12 machines produce 600 items in 4 hours. How many machines to produce 900 items in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Rate per machine = $\frac{600}{12 \times 4}$ items/hour. Find machines for new production.

questions.question: A and B together finish in 10 days. A worked alone for 4 days, then B alone for 12 days to finish. A alone takes?
questions.hint: Let A's time = a days, B's = b days. Set up: $\frac{4}{a} + \frac{12}{b} = 1$ and $\frac{1}{a} + \frac{1}{b} = \frac{1}{10}$.

questions.question: A tank is $\frac{2}{5}$ full. Pipe A can fill it in 10 min, Pipe B can empty it in 6 min. Both open, when is it empty?
questions.hint: Net rate of emptying = $\frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{10}$. Time to empty $\frac{2}{5}$?

questions.question: Two trains 300 km apart travel toward each other at 40 km/h and 50 km/h. A bird flies between them at 100 km/h until they meet. How far does the bird fly?
questions.hint: Time until trains meet = $300 \div 90$. Bird flies entire time at 100 km/h.

questions.question: Worker A's efficiency doubles after lunch. A takes 6 hours total (3 before, 3 after lunch) for a job. How long for normal efficiency throughout?
questions.hint: Before lunch: $\frac{3}{x}$ work. After: $\frac{6}{x}$ work (double rate). Total = 1.

questions.question: A cistern has a leak which empties it in 12 hours. A tap fills it at 4 L/min. If capacity is 1440 L, how long to fill with leak?
questions.hint: Fill rate = 240 L/h. Leak rate = 120 L/h. Net = 120 L/h for 1440 L.

questions.question: Three pipes A, B, C fill a tank in 6, 8, and 12 hours. A and B run for 2 hours, then C joins. Total time?
questions.hint: A+B do $\frac{2}{6} + \frac{2}{8}$ in 2 hours. All three finish the rest.

questions.question: A man rows 36 km downstream in 3 hours. If stream speed is $\frac{1}{3}$ of boat speed in still water, find still water speed.
questions.hint: Let boat speed = b. Downstream = $b + \frac{b}{3} = \frac{4b}{3} = 12$ km/h.

questions.question: 20 workers can finish a job in 30 days. After 10 days, 5 workers quit. They hire new workers who are 50% as efficient. How many new workers to finish on time?
questions.hint: Work done in 10 days. Remaining work in 20 days with 15 workers + new workers at half rate.

questions.question: A train 180 m long passes another train 120 m long running opposite direction in 6 seconds. If slower train is at 36 km/h, find faster train's speed.
questions.hint: Total distance = 300 m. Combined speed = 50 m/s = 180 km/h. Faster = $180 - 36$.

questions.question: A and B can complete work in 12 days. B and C in 15 days. A and C in 20 days. How long for A alone?
questions.hint: Add all three equations, divide by 2 for individual sum. Then solve for A.

questions.question: A car travels first third of distance at 20 km/h, second third at 30 km/h, last third at 60 km/h. Average speed?
questions.hint: Let total distance = 60 km. Times: 1 + $\frac{2}{3}$ + $\frac{1}{3}$ = 2 hours.

questions.question: Inlet A fills tank in 6 hours. With both A and outlet B open, it takes 9 hours. How long for B to empty a full tank?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{B} = \frac{1}{9}$. Solve for B.

questions.question: 5 men and 2 boys can do work in 4 days. Same work by 2 men and 5 boys in 5 days. How long for 1 man alone?
questions.hint: Set up two equations with man-rate and boy-rate. Solve the system.

questions.question: A boat can travel 48 km downstream and 32 km upstream in 6 hours total. Also 32 km downstream and 24 km upstream in 5 hours. Find boat speed in still water.
questions.hint: Let downstream = d, upstream = u. Set up two equations with time.

questions.question: Machine A produces 100 units in 4 hours. Machine B produces 80 units in 5 hours. Working together for 3 hours, then A breaks. How long for B to produce 100 more?
questions.hint: In 3 hours: A makes 75, B makes 48. Need $100 - 48 = 52$ more from B alone.

questions.question: A train passes a station platform in 36 seconds and a man standing on platform in 20 seconds. Platform length is 320 m. Find train's length.
questions.hint: Speed = length/20 = (length + 320)/36. Cross multiply.

questions.question: Two workers A and B are hired. A gets paid 150% of what B gets. Together they complete work in 8 hours worth $240. What does A earn?
questions.hint: If B earns x, A earns 1.5x. Total = 2.5x = 240.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 24 hours. Pipe B fills in 32 hours. Both work for 8 hours, then A is closed and C (empties in 40 hours) is opened. How much longer to fill?
questions.hint: After 8 hours: $\frac{8}{24} + \frac{8}{32} = \frac{7}{12}$ full. B - C fills remainder.

questions.question: A man walks at 5 km/h and cycles at 15 km/h. He covers 50 km in 5 hours using both. How far did he cycle?
questions.hint: Let cycling distance = c. Walking = 50-c. Time: $\frac{c}{15} + \frac{50-c}{5} = 5$.

questions.question: A project requires 12 men for 25 days. After 5 days, 3 men become sick. How many extra days needed?
questions.hint: Work done in 5 days by 12 men. Remaining work by 9 men takes how many extra days?

questions.question: Two cars start together. One at 40 km/h, other at 60 km/h. The slower one takes 2 hours more to cover a distance. What is the distance?
questions.hint: Let distance = d. $\frac{d}{40} - \frac{d}{60} = 2$. Solve for d.

questions.question: A can do work in 15 days. B is 50% more efficient than A. C is 50% less efficient than A. All three together?
questions.hint: A = 15 days, B = 10 days, C = 30 days. Add rates.

questions.question: A tank is $\frac{3}{4}$ full. Inlet adds 20 L/min, outlet removes 15 L/min. Tank fills completely in 30 min. Find tank capacity.
questions.hint: Net flow is +5 L/min. In 30 min, adds 150 L. This is the remaining $\frac{1}{4}$.

questions.question: A and B start a work. A works 6 days and leaves. B finishes remaining in 9 days. If A had worked 9 days and left, B would finish in 4 days. How long for each alone?
questions.hint: Two equations: $\frac{6}{a} + \frac{9}{b} = 1$ and $\frac{9}{a} + \frac{4}{b} = 1$. Solve.

questions.question: A train running at 72 km/h crosses a platform twice its length in 36 seconds. Find the platform length.
questions.hint: Speed = 20 m/s. If train = L, platform = 2L. Time = 3L/20 = 36. Solve for L.

questions.question: Worker A completes 40% of a job in 8 days. B joins, they finish the rest in 6 days. How long for B alone for whole job?
questions.hint: A's rate = 5% per day. Together they do 60% in 6 days = 10% per day. B's rate = 5%.

questions.question: Two pipes can fill a tank in 20 minutes and 30 minutes. A drain empties it in 15 minutes. How long to fill if all are open?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{20} + \frac{1}{30} - \frac{1}{15}$. Find LCM of 20, 30, 15.

questions.question: A covers a journey in 5 hours. First half at 60 km/h, second half at some other speed. If total distance is 240 km, find the other speed.
questions.hint: First 120 km at 60 km/h = 2 hours. Remaining 120 km in 3 hours.

questions.question: 6 women and 8 men complete work in 10 days. 26 men and 48 women complete it in 2 days. How long for 1 man alone?
questions.hint: Set up two equations: (6w + 8m) × 10 = 1 and (26m + 48w) × 2 = 1.

questions.question: A boat's downstream speed is 18 km/h. The ratio of boat speed to current speed is 5:1. Find upstream speed.
questions.hint: If boat = 5x, current = x. Downstream = 6x = 18. Find upstream = 4x.

questions.question: A job is done by A in 10 days and B in 15 days. They work on alternate days starting with A. How long to complete?
questions.hint: In 2 days (A then B), they do $\frac{1}{10} + \frac{1}{15} = \frac{1}{6}$. After 5 cycles...

questions.question: A train traveling at 90 km/h takes 20 seconds to cross another train traveling opposite at 60 km/h. If first train is 200 m long, find second train's length.
questions.hint: Relative speed = 150 km/h = $\frac{125}{3}$ m/s. Total length = speed × time.

questions.question: A contractor employed 30 men to complete work in 40 days. After 20 days, he adds 20 more men. How many days early will work finish?
questions.hint: In 20 days, 30 men do half the work. Remaining half with 50 men.

questions.question: Tap A fills in 15 hours, B fills in 20 hours, C empties in 30 hours. Tank is half full. All three open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{15} + \frac{1}{20} - \frac{1}{30} = \frac{1}{20}$. Time for half tank?

questions.question: A machine makes 80 items per hour. After maintenance, efficiency increases by 25%. How long to make 500 items with improved machine?
questions.hint: New rate = 80 × 1.25 = 100 items/hour. Time = 500/100.

questions.question: Two men can complete a task in 6 hours. One man and one boy can do it in 9 hours. How long for two boys?
questions.hint: Man's rate = $\frac{1}{12}$ per hour. From equation 2, find boy's rate.

questions.question: Car goes 300 km. For first 100 km at 50 km/h. To average 60 km/h for whole trip, what speed for remaining 200 km?
questions.hint: Total time should be 5 hours for 60 km/h average. First 100 km takes 2 hours.

questions.question: A cistern is filled by A in 10 hours and by B in 15 hours. It has a leak that empties a full cistern in 20 hours. All working, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{10} + \frac{1}{15} - \frac{1}{20}$. Find common denominator 60.

questions.question: A train 250 m long runs at 80 km/h. How long to pass a man running at 8 km/h in the same direction?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 72 km/h = 20 m/s. Time = 250/20.

questions.question: A completes $\frac{1}{4}$ of work in 2 days. B joins for 4 days. C joins, all three finish in 2 more days. If C takes 12 days alone, B alone?
questions.hint: A's rate = $\frac{1}{8}$/day. Work out what A+B do in 4 days, then what all three do.

questions.question: A car and a bus start toward each other from towns 600 km apart. Car at 80 km/h, bus at 40 km/h. Where do they meet from car's start?
questions.hint: Time to meet = 600/120 = 5 hours. Car travels 80 × 5.

questions.question: Two inlets fill a pool in 4 hours and 6 hours. With both inlets and a drain open, it takes 3 hours. How long for drain alone to empty?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{d} = \frac{1}{3}$. Solve for d.

questions.question: Worker A does 2 units per day, B does 3 units per day. A works for 3 days, then B joins. Total work is 30 units. How long does B work?
questions.hint: A does 6 units in 3 days. Then A+B do 5 units/day. Remaining 24 units take?

questions.question: A boat takes 4 hours to go 28 km downstream and 6 hours to return. Find the speed of the boat in still water.
questions.hint: Downstream = 7 km/h, upstream = 4.67 km/h. Boat = $(7 + 4.67)/2$.

questions.question: 16 men finish work in 25 days. After working for 5 days, 6 men leave. How many more days to complete?
questions.hint: In 5 days, 16 men do $\frac{5}{25} = \frac{1}{5}$. Remaining $\frac{4}{5}$ by 10 men.

questions.question: A train 400 m long passes a man in 20 seconds and a train 600 m long moving same direction in 100 seconds. Second train's speed?
questions.hint: First train: 72 km/h. Relative speed for passing = 36 km/h. Second = 72 - 36.

questions.question: Pipe A fills a tank in 6 hours. After 2 hours, leak develops that empties tank in 12 hours. How long total to fill?
questions.hint: After 2 hours, tank is $\frac{1}{3}$ full. Net rate = $\frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{12} = \frac{1}{12}$.

questions.question: A and B finish work in 8 days. A worked 2 days, then B worked 5 days, completing 50%. How long for A alone?
questions.hint: $\frac{2}{a} + \frac{5}{b} = 0.5$ and $\frac{1}{a} + \frac{1}{b} = \frac{1}{8}$. Solve system.

questions.question: A cyclist covers 24 km in 2 hours. If speed is increased by 4 km/h, time saved is?
questions.hint: Original speed = 12 km/h. New speed = 16 km/h. New time = 1.5 hours.

questions.question: 4 men and 6 women finish in 8 days. 3 men and 7 women finish in 10 days. How long for 10 women?
questions.hint: Set up two equations to find man-rate and woman-rate. Then calculate for 10 women.

questions.question: A boat covers 40 km upstream in 8 hours. It covers same distance downstream in 5 hours. Speed of stream?
questions.hint: Upstream = 5 km/h, downstream = 8 km/h. Current = $(8 - 5)/2$.

questions.question: A can complete $\frac{2}{3}$ of work when B completes $\frac{1}{2}$. Together they take 12 days. A alone?
questions.hint: Ratio of rates A:B = $\frac{2}{3}:\frac{1}{2}$ = 4:3. Use this to find individual times.

questions.question: Two trains start at same time from A and B, 200 km apart, toward each other. They meet in 2 hours. If first train is 10 km/h faster, where do they meet from A?
questions.hint: Combined = 100 km/h. If faster is (x+10), slower is x. Solve 2x + 10 = 100.

questions.question: A tank has capacity 300 L. Pipe A fills 20 L/min, B fills 10 L/min. A runs for 5 min, then B joins. How long from start until full?
questions.hint: In 5 min, A fills 100 L. Remaining 200 L at 30 L/min.

questions.question: Worker A is 20% less efficient than B. B takes 15 hours for a job. How long for both together?
questions.hint: A is 80% of B's efficiency, so A takes $15/0.8 = 18.75$ hours. Add rates.

questions.question: A train 150 m long crosses a bridge in 30 seconds at 36 km/h. What is the bridge length?
questions.hint: Speed = 10 m/s. Total distance = 300 m. Bridge = 300 - 150.

questions.question: Pipes A and B fill tank in 8 hours and 12 hours. C empties it in 6 hours. If tank is $\frac{1}{2}$ full and all open, what happens in 12 hours?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{8} + \frac{1}{12} - \frac{1}{6}$. Is it positive or negative?

questions.question: A does half a job in 6 days. Then B, who is twice as efficient, joins. How long total?
questions.hint: A's rate = $\frac{1}{12}$/day. B's rate = $\frac{1}{6}$/day. Combined for remaining half.

questions.question: Car A at 50 km/h starts 30 minutes before Car B at 65 km/h. Same direction. After how long from A's start does B overtake?
questions.hint: A's head start = 25 km. B gains 15 km/h. Time for B after its start = $\frac{25}{15}$ hours.

questions.question: 15 machines produce 270 items in 3 hours. How many machines to produce 360 items in 2 hours?
questions.hint: Rate per machine = $270/(15 \times 3) = 6$ items/hour. Need 180 items/hour.

questions.question: A man rows 10 km upstream in 2.5 hours. If still water speed is twice current speed, find current.
questions.hint: Let current = c, still water = 2c. Upstream = c. Speed = 10/2.5 = 4 km/h = c.

questions.question: A and B can complete work in 30 days and 15 days. They work together for 5 days, then A leaves. B finishes alone. Total days?
questions.hint: In 5 days: $\frac{5}{30} + \frac{5}{15} = \frac{1}{2}$. B does remaining half.

questions.question: Two trains leave same station at same time in opposite directions at 40 km/h and 60 km/h. After how long are they 250 km apart?
questions.hint: They separate at 100 km/h. Time = 250/100 = 2.5 hours.

questions.question: Tank filled by A in 5 hours, B in 10 hours. A runs for 1 hour, then B joins. After 2 more hours, drain D opens (empties in 15 hours). Total time?
questions.hint: After 3 hours (1 alone, 2 together), tank is $\frac{4}{5}$ full. Then A+B-D fills rest.

questions.question: A completes job in 12 days. After 3 days, B joins and they finish in 3 more days. How long for B alone?
questions.hint: A does $\frac{3}{12} = \frac{1}{4}$ in first 3 days. Together do $\frac{3}{4}$ in 3 days.

questions.question: A plane flies 400 km at 200 km/h, then 600 km at 300 km/h. What is average speed for whole trip?
questions.hint: Total distance = 1000 km. Total time = 2 + 2 = 4 hours.

questions.question: 8 workers at 6 hours/day finish in 12 days. How long for 6 workers at 8 hours/day?
questions.hint: Total work = 8 × 6 × 12 = 576 worker-hours. Divide by 6 × 8.

questions.question: A boat goes 36 km downstream in 4 hours. If boat speed is 3 times current speed, find current.
questions.hint: Downstream speed = 9 km/h = 4c (boat + current = 3c + c).

questions.question: Two taps fill in 20 min and 30 min. Drain empties in 15 min. Starting empty with all open, when is tank half full?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{20} + \frac{1}{30} - \frac{1}{15} = \frac{1}{60}$. Time for half?

questions.question: A train 200 m long traveling at 54 km/h will pass a 400 m long train traveling opposite at 36 km/h in?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 90 km/h = 25 m/s. Total distance = 600 m.

questions.question: If 5 men or 8 women can do work in 12 days, how long for 3 men and 4 women?
questions.hint: 5m = 8w rate-wise. Express all in terms of woman-equivalents.

questions.question: A walks at 4 km/h. B starts 15 min later at 5 km/h. How far from start when B catches A?
questions.hint: A's head start = 1 km. B gains 1 km/h. Catch time = 1 hour after B starts.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 10 hours. With leak, it takes 15 hours. If tank is full, how long to empty through leak alone?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{10} - \frac{1}{L} = \frac{1}{15}$. Solve for L.

questions.question: A can finish work in 18 days. B is 50% more efficient. They work together but B leaves 3 days early. Total time?
questions.hint: B takes 12 days alone. Let total time = t. A works t days, B works (t-3) days.

questions.question: Two cyclists start from same point. One cycles east at 12 km/h, other north at 16 km/h. After 3 hours, their distance apart?
questions.hint: East: 36 km, North: 48 km. Use Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: A tank of capacity 1200 L is emptied in 10 hours through a leak. Inlet adds 50 L/h. If both leak and inlet work, how long to empty full tank?
questions.hint: Leak rate = 120 L/h. Net outflow = 120 - 50 = 70 L/h.

questions.question: Worker P does twice the work of Q in $\frac{3}{4}$ of Q's time. If P takes 12 days, how long for Q?
questions.hint: If Q takes t days, P does 2x work in 0.75t time = 12 days. Ratio analysis needed.

questions.question: A train passes two persons walking in same direction at 3 km/h and 5 km/h in 8 and 7.2 seconds respectively. Train's length?
questions.hint: Let train speed = v. $\frac{L}{v-3} = 8$ and $\frac{L}{v-5} = 7.2$ (convert speeds to m/s).

questions.question: A and B work on alternate days, A starting. If A can do work in 10 days and B in 15 days, how long to complete?
questions.hint: In 2 days: $\frac{1}{10} + \frac{1}{15} = \frac{1}{6}$. After 10 days, work done = $\frac{5}{6}$.

questions.question: A plane's groundspeed is 600 km/h with 50 km/h headwind. For return journey with tailwind, how long for same 1200 km?
questions.hint: Plane's airspeed = 650 km/h. With tailwind = 700 km/h. Time = 1200/700.

questions.question: 15 men complete half work in 18 days. For remaining half in 15 days, how many more men needed?
questions.hint: 15 men do half in 18 days. For same half in 15 days, need 18 men.

questions.question: A boat goes 60 km upstream and back in 10 hours. If current is 4 km/h, find boat speed in still water.
questions.hint: $\frac{60}{b-4} + \frac{60}{b+4} = 10$. Solve the quadratic.

questions.question: Tap A fills in 12 hours. After 4 hours, tap B (fills in 6 hours) opens. After 2 more hours, outlet C (empties in 8 hours) opens. Total time?
questions.hint: After 4h: $\frac{1}{3}$ full. After 6h: $\frac{1}{3} + \frac{2}{12} + \frac{2}{6} = \frac{5}{6}$. Then all three work.

questions.question: A can do work in 20 days. After 5 days, B joins who is twice as fast. After 3 more days, C joins who is three times as fast as A. Total time?
questions.hint: A's 5 days + (A+B)'s 3 days + (A+B+C)'s remaining. Calculate step by step.

questions.question: Two trains 540 km apart. One at 60 km/h, other at 80 km/h toward each other. A fly at 100 km/h goes back and forth between them. How far does fly travel?
questions.hint: Time until trains meet = 540/140. Fly travels entire time at 100 km/h.

questions.question: A factory employs 50 workers at 8 hours/day to produce 1000 units in 10 days. To produce 1500 units in 6 days, working 10 hours/day, how many workers?
questions.hint: Work = workers × hours × days. Set up proportion: $50 \times 8 \times 10 \times 1500$...

questions.question: A cistern filled by two pipes in 12 and 16 hours has a leak emptying it in 24 hours. Starting empty, how long until $\frac{3}{4}$ full?
questions.hint: Net rate = $\frac{1}{12} + \frac{1}{16} - \frac{1}{24}$. Find time for $\frac{3}{4}$.

questions.question: A man cycles 12 km at 15 km/h, walks 4 km at 5 km/h, runs 6 km at 12 km/h. Average speed?
questions.hint: Total distance = 22 km. Total time = 0.8 + 0.8 + 0.5 = 2 hours.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 8 hours. With pipes A and B, tank fills in 5 hours. How long for B alone?
questions.hint: $\frac{1}{8} + \frac{1}{B} = \frac{1}{5}$. Solve for B.

questions.question: A and B do job in 20 days and 30 days. They work 5 days, then C joins. All finish in 3 more days. C alone?
questions.hint: After 5 days: $\frac{5}{20} + \frac{5}{30} = \frac{5}{12}$. Remaining $\frac{7}{12}$ in 3 days by all three.

questions.question: A train traveling at 90 km/h passes an electric pole in 12 seconds. How long to pass a platform 200 m longer than the train?
questions.hint: Train length = 25 × 12 = 300 m. Platform = 500 m. Total = 800 m at 25 m/s.

questions.question: A can complete 80% of work in 20 days. B is 50% less efficient. How long for B to complete 60% of work?
questions.hint: A's rate = 4% per day. B's rate = 2% per day. Time for 60%?

questions.question: A boat takes 6 hours to travel 36 km upstream. If boat speed is 5 times the current speed, find downstream time for same distance.
questions.hint: Upstream = 4c = 6 km/h. So c = 1.5. Downstream = 6c = 9 km/h.

questions.question: Three workers A, B, C together take 4 hours. A and B take 6 hours. B and C take 8 hours. How long for A and C together?
questions.hint: From the three equations, find individual rates. Then combine A and C.
